title: Diagnosing Tomato Leaf Disease
description: Identify and treat a common tomato disease based on symptoms.

steps.instruction: You notice brown spots with yellow halos on your tomato leaves. What disease is this likely to be?
steps.success_feedback: Correct! This is a classic symptom of blight, a fungal disease.
steps.failure_feedback: Incorrect. Brown spots with yellow halos are characteristic of blight.

steps.instruction: What is the first action you should take to prevent spread?
steps.success_feedback: Good! Removing infected leaves prevents spores from spreading.
steps.failure_feedback: You should remove affected leaves immediately to stop the disease from spreading.

steps.instruction: What treatment should you apply to the remaining plants?
steps.success_feedback: Excellent! Copper-based fungicides are effective against blight.
steps.failure_feedback: Copper fungicide is the recommended treatment for blight.
